definition[0]: to become friends and start to have a relationship
example[0]: We learned later that he and Tanya had paired up.
definition[1]: to work together to do something or to put two people together to do something
example[1]: They first paired up in the screen adaptation of ‘Grease’.
example[2]: They have paired up writers and artists, and commissioned linked works.
definition[2]: if animals pair up, they come together in order to breed
definition[3]: if two people or companies pair up, or are paired up, they work together
example[3]: Six months ago the company created a ‘buddy system’ which paired up employees.
example[4]: To avoid losing his company, Mr. Ross paired up with Chris-Craft Industries Inc.
